relevant_findings.general: The patient appeared to be in pain and was lying extremely still and rigid in bed. No lymphadenopathy was noted.
relevant_findings.abdominal: Distant bowel sounds were present, exquisite tenderness to palpation in the right and left lower quadrants, rebound, and guarding were noted. No hepatosplenomegaly.
relevant_findings.kidney: Tenderness at the costovertebral angle on the right side.
relevant_findings.leg: Mildly swollen left lower leg without erythema.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Creatinine level increased from 1.1 mg/dL to 1.3 mg/dL.

relevant_findings.urine: Continued to have dark, tea-colored urine.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Serum creatinine level rose from 1.3 mg/dL to 1.5 mg/dL.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Complete resolution of hematuria and pain symptoms.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Symptoms gradually resolved over the next several weeks.
